intro: Globimetula cornutibracteata, commonly known as the horned bract globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its globular shape and distinctive, horn-like bracts that surround its inflorescence. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and opposite, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Globimetula cornutibracteata is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
